Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Advocates point to the expansion of the federal child tax credit as proof that direct cash payments to families reduce poverty.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Advocates point to the expansion of the federal child tax credit as proof that direct cash payments to families reduce poverty.

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Still some opponents said these types of programs discourage participation in the labor market, are too costly and fail to sufficiently reform the welfare system to bring working people out of poverty.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Still some opponents said these types of programs discourage participation in the labor market, are too costly and fail to sufficiently reform the welfare system to bring working people out of poverty.

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Participants report feeling more free to spend money on self care, outings with family members or sharing their wealth with community members.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Participants report feeling more free to spend money on self care, outings with family members or sharing their wealth with community members.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “With all the struggling I was doing, my attitude took a hit,” Kahlia said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The more you witness yourself being down and out, the more you feel down and out, and the more stuck you feel.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The pilot program will allow researchers to track its impact in a large, diverse region, said Sean Kline, director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Whenever L.A. city or county or Chicago or New York do something bold like this, it’s a really important signal that this big policy idea found its footing during COVID and represents a possible way forward in terms of supporting low income people across America,” Kline said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: One question the Breathe program raises, Kline said, is what does it mean to have extra money for months versus several years?
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “If you knew the money was coming for three years, it’s a much longer runway.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Can you go back to school?
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Can you quit your job now and look for a new one?
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Can you care for your aging parents?”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Every six months, program participants and members in the control group receive the same survey questions about their wellbeing, financially and mentally, said Amy Castro, director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “There is so much we don’t know yet,” Castro said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We don’t know how long people need to receive cash to create what level of change.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: More than halfway through the Breathe program, Kahlia said she and her business remain a work in progress, but the funds have given her an ability to move forward in a way she hadn’t before.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It’s taking me from always putting out fires to being able to actually make some moves to advance, not just being stuck,” Kahlia said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I didn’t expect to be accepted,” to the Breathe program, Kahlia said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “When I was, I was really, really pleasantly surprised.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: It definitely took the edge off.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Kahlia said she doesn’t keep track of how she spends the Breathe money.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: A lot of it has gone to health expenses, and some has gone to her business.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: But she also spends it on day-to-day things like groceries, or a taco night out with friends, she said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I’m probably getting more comfortable with spending money,” she said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Just learning to say yes to stuff.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: There’s some stuff that, at the beginning of the program I felt was, you know, almost extravagant.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: And now I’m like ‘Oh my god, I really needed that for my business to move forward.’”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: There’s also anecdotal evidence that participants are spending some on things that may help them build wealth, like starting a business or saving for a down payment on a home, said Brian Arredondo, a coach for program participants.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a coach for program participants.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: He said participants come to him with a huge variety of needs, from questions about investing and money management to how to find a good mechanic.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a coach for program participants.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: When Kahlia wanted to lease a new car, she went to Arredondo, who helped her research the used car market.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a coach for program participants.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: He has helped other participants look for new cars and accompanied them to dealerships.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a coach for program participants.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “People need help with normal, everyday interactions that may be easy for some individuals,” he said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a coach for program participants.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “But for others, they don’t have any prior experience with them.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a coach for program participants.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: It’s those hard-to-measure impacts that are key, said Ely Fournier, who oversees the program coaches at Strength Based Community Change.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: who oversees the program coaches at Strength Based Community Change.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It can’t just be the money,” Fournier said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: who oversees the program coaches at Strength Based Community Change.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It’s the opportunity and the access to experiences sometimes that really make a big difference when there is even a little bit more resources folks can have.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: who oversees the program coaches at Strength Based Community Change.
who oversees the program coaches at Strength Based Community Change.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The program funds have given her time, she said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I haven’t gotten to the sexy part yet,” Kahlia said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I had to get stronger and healthier, clear space, and lay a foundation first.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Pulling yourself out of a hole often doesn’t look dramatic.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: For me it’s been the ability to do some fairly tedious stuff over an extended period of time, over and over again.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists.; Kahlia was selected as one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Researchers at the University of Pennsylvania are surveying the 1,000 Breathe participants, along with a control group of people not receiving funds.
While there were positive impacts on mental health and wellbeing the first year, when the pandemic broke out, the benefits were less pronounced, according to Penn’s research.
The lab found, in general, that food and groceries are the top way participants are spending money, making up 35% of the funds spent.
Named Organization Sources.Source_Justification: the Stanford Guaranteed Income Lab tracks 31 pilot programs throughout the country, including the Breathe pilot.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The program’s coaches, provided through Wilmington-based Strength Based Community Change, personally support participants as their lives change.
Strength Based Community Change also offers workshops on financial literacy, investing and credit repair.
